manifest.name: jest-watch-typeahead
manifest.description: Jest plugin for filtering by filename or test name
manifest.readme:
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/jest-community/jest-watch-typeahead.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/jest-community/jest-watch-typeahead) [![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/jest-watch-typeahead.svg)](https://badge.fury.io/js/jest-watch-typeahead)

jest-watch-typeahead

Filter your tests by file name or test name

![watch](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/574806/40672937-25dab91a-6325-11e8-965d-4e55ef23e135.gif) ## Usage ### Install Install `jest`_(it needs Jest 26+)_ and `jest-watch-typeahead` ```bash yarn add --dev jest jest-watch-typeahead # or with NPM npm install --save-dev jest jest-watch-typeahead ``` ### Add it to your Jest config In your `package.json` ```json { "jest": { "watchPlugins": [ "jest-watch-typeahead/filename", "jest-watch-typeahead/testname" ] } } ``` Or in `jest.config.js` ```js module.exports = { watchPlugins: [ 'jest-watch-typeahead/filename', 'jest-watch-typeahead/testname', ], }; ``` ### Configuring your key and prompt name ```js module.exports = { watchPlugins: [ [ 'jest-watch-typeahead/filename', { key: 'k', prompt: 'do something with my custom prompt', }, ], ], }; ``` ### Run Jest in watch mode ```bash yarn jest --watch ```
